Header: Death toll climbs to at least 27 in Iraq on third day of protests- police, medics
Content: Iraqi security forces opened fire on thousands of demonstrators who defied a curfew in Baghdad and exchanged fire with gunmen in a southern city, killing two people on the third day of nationwide anti-government protests. The protests, in which at least 27 have now been killed and over 600 wounded, began over unemployment and poor services but have escalated into calls for a change of government and pose one of the worst security challenges in years.They appear to be independent of any political party and seemingly took the security forces by surprise.At least 4,000 protesters gathered in Baghdadâ€™s Tayaran Square and attempted to march onto the central Tahrir Square only to be met with open fire and heavy tear gas.Police used live ammunition in the Zaafaraniya district of Baghdad, where a protester was shot dead, and there were protests in the northwestern Shula district.
